#3. Get an input from the user to print the Fibonacci sequence starting from the 1st input up to 500. Use repeat and break statements. Write the R Scripts and its output.

# Function to calculate Fibonacci sequence
fibonacci <- function(n) {
 if (n <= 1) {
    return(n)
 } else {
    return(fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2))
 }
}

# Input from the user
n <- as.integer(readline(prompt="Enter a number (1-500): "))

# Validate the input
if (n < 1 || n > 500) {
 cat("Invalid input! Please enter a number between 1 and 500.\n")
} else {
 # Calculate and print the Fibonacci sequence
 cat("Fibonacci sequence starting from ", n, ":\n")
 for (i in n:500) {
    cat(fibonacci(i), "\n")
 }
}



#3
# Function to calculate Fibonacci sequence
fibonacci <- function(n) {
  if (n <= 1) {
    return(n)
  } else {
    return(fibonacci(n-1) + fibonacci(n-2))
  }
}

# Input from the user
n <- as.integer(readline(prompt="Enter a number (1-500): "))

# Validate the input
if (n < 1 || n > 500) {
  cat("Invalid input! Please enter a number between 1 and 500.\n")
} else {
  # Calculate and print the Fibonacci sequence
  cat("Fibonacci sequence starting from ", n, ":\n")
  
  i <- n
  repeat {
    fib_value <- fibonacci(i)
    
    if (fib_value > 500) {
      break
    }
    
    cat(fib_value, "\n")
    
    i <- i + 1
  }
}
